actor: Doña Ana County Board of Commissioners
statement_or_action: Vote 4-1 to approve Ordinance 367-2025 (IRB) and Ordinance 368-2025 (LEDA/GRT agreement).

notes: Named vote breakdown compiled from county commissioner listings and lawsuit/news references in user files.

actor: Doña Ana County Board of Commissioners

Yes: Christopher Schaljo-Hernandez, Gloria Gameros, Shannon Reynolds, Manuel A. Sanchez. No: Susana Chaparro.

actor: Doña Ana County & BorderPlex Digital Assets LLC
statement_or_action: County agrees to provide a GRT Share (LEDA incentive) totaling up to $50,000,000 for eligible project costs.
contractual_obligation: Provide GRT Share payments up to $50M, subject to documentation and annual performance review.
enforcement_mechanism: PPA provides annual performance review, audit rights, withholding of disbursements for noncompliance; termination via ordinance; clawback penalty for nonpayment by company where required.

actor: Doña Ana County & BorderPlex Digital Assets LLC
statement_or_action: County agrees to reduce permit fees by $4,500,000 (permit fee reductions).
enforcement_mechanism: Administered through county permitting; enforcement largely administrative; verify clawback/remedy language in PPA.

statement_or_action: Annual PILOT payments totaling $12,000,000 per year for 30 years (public reporting).
notes: Breakdown among County and school districts reported in article; verify against each lease's §5.10 and Exhibit C allocations.

actor: BorderPlex Digital Assets LLC (via MOU Appendix B)
statement_or_action: Total contributions of $6,900,000 (workforce, Boys & Girls Club, desalination exploration, DACC transit aid, habitat protection).
contractual_obligation: Make listed contributions in Appendix B; conditional on MOU execution and ordinance approvals.
enforcement_mechanism: MOU §5.2 makes contributions binding; remedies not specified in MOU beyond standard contract enforcement; verify whether leases specify default/remedies tied to contributions.

statement_or_action: Reported total PILOT is $12M/year across subseries; Series 2025A lease shows $3M/year starting 2026-12-31. Remaining subseries amounts must sum to reported total.
source_locator: Compare reporting to each subseries lease §5.10 amounts.
notes: Verify Series 2025B and 2025C PILOT amounts and allocations; compute total from executed leases and indentures.

statement_or_action: PILOT payment in lieu of taxes begins Dec 31, 2026: $3,000,000 (Series 2025A lease).
contractual_obligation: Pay annual PILOT; subject to increases under lease.
enforcement_mechanism: Issuer can terminate lease for nonpayment after notice; other subseries may cure by paying; termination delayed 30 days after notice.

statement_or_action: $4,000,000 contribution for workforce development programs (CTE facility, public safety campus, NMSU workforce).
contractual_obligation: Make $4M contribution for specified workforce and public safety initiatives.
enforcement_mechanism: Binding via lease and MOU Appendix B contributions; payment schedules must be verified in appendices.

statement_or_action: $1,500,000 one-time contribution for local initiatives including Phase I of new Boys and Girls Club facility.
enforcement_mechanism: Binding via lease and MOU Appendix B contributions; confirm deliverable list and timing.

statement_or_action: IRBs authorized in max aggregate principal amount up to $165,000,000,000 (IRB ordinance quote as captured in evidence files).
source_locator: Fact sheet and evidence notes referencing Ordinance 367-2025.
notes: Primary ordinance PDF not retrieved via web tool; verify against certified ordinance record if needed.

actor: Doña Ana County (Issuer) & BorderPlex Digital Assets LLC (Developer)
statement_or_action: County provides full (100%) abatement of real and personal property taxes for 30 years (per MOU).
contractual_obligation: Provide 100% property tax abatement for 30-year term.
enforcement_mechanism: Via IRB/lease structure; enforceability depends on ordinance/lease validity; subject to legal challenges.

actor: Red Chiles [A/B/C/D], LLC & Green Chile Ventures LLC (Series 2025B)
statement_or_action: Closed-loop cooling; average water use 20,000 gpd; peak water use capped at 60,000 gpd; fund water and wastewater line extensions and construct lift station.
source_locator: Lease recitals (P13) on water and infrastructure.
contractual_obligation: Operate with closed-loop cooling; cap peak water use at 60k gpd; fund required water/wastewater extensions; build lift station.
enforcement_mechanism: Included in lease (binding instrument). Verify whether covenant exists beyond recitals; remedies would flow through Events of Default / clawback provisions if defined.

statement_or_action: Hire 750 full-time and 50 part-time employees within three years of commencing operations; project 2,500 construction jobs (2025-2028); salaries shall be $75,000–$100,000.
source_locator: Lease recitals (P14) on jobs and wages.
contractual_obligation: Employment and wage commitments stated in lease documents.
enforcement_mechanism: Lease includes job target dates and PILOT increase mechanism tied to employment (see §4.20 in lease).

timestamp: Commencing with issuance of bonds (per lease)
statement_or_action: Use best efforts for County First hiring strategy; coordinate job fairs and website; prioritize qualified Doña Ana County applicants.
contractual_obligation: Best-efforts local hiring and County First strategy.
enforcement_mechanism: Best-efforts standard; verify whether failure triggers clawback/PILOT increase or abatement repayment schedule.

statement_or_action: Project will not impact existing customers power reliability or costs.
notes: Statement appears as a lease recital; verify operational enforcement clause or metric.

actor: Stephen Lopez (Assistant County Manager, Doña Ana County)
statement_or_action: Stated Project Jupiter could bring high-paying jobs and workforce development opportunities to southern New Mexico.
notes: Public-facing promise framing; quantify against lease job/wage commitments and verify delivery via annual reports/performance reviews.

actor: Doña Ana County & BorderPlex Digital Assets LLC
statement_or_action: Annual performance review and audit rights; county may withhold disbursements until compliance; termination of GRT Share Term via ordinance; GRT share clawback includes 100% penalty if company fails to pay amounts owed.
source_locator: PPA §3.5 Annual Performance Review; §3.6 audits; §5.3 termination; §5.4 GRT Share Clawback.
enforcement_mechanism: Withholding disbursements; audits; termination by ordinance; 100% penalty clawback if company fails to pay owed amounts.

actor: Doña Ana County & BorderPlex Digital Assets LLC
statement_or_action: MOU states it does not create legal rights or obligations, except binding contributions in Appendix B (and only upon MOU execution and ordinance approvals).
enforcement_mechanism: Limits enforceability of non-contribution commitments in MOU; contributions enforceable contingent on approvals.

timestamp: Commencing with issuance of bonds (per lease)
statement_or_action: Abated tax repayment schedule listed: Years 0-3 repay 100% of abated tax; Year 4 repay 70%; Year 5 repay 40%; Year 6+ repay 0%.
source_locator: Lease §4.18 area includes abated tax repayment schedule (table).
enforcement_mechanism: Clawback schedule for abatement benefits (trigger conditions need verification in lease's clawback sections).

statement_or_action: PILOT Increase mechanism tied to employment targets; issuer may require increased PILOT if job targets missed after cure period.
enforcement_mechanism: Increase in PILOT payments following employment shortfalls, subject to cure period and annual report.

statement_or_action: Signed agreements were produced to the public only days before the Sept 19 vote; updated agreements not released prior to vote; IPRA responses delayed.
source_locator: Amended Motion for Stay attachment (letter) describing timing of document production.
timeline_discrepancy: Late disclosure vs decision date; limited public review time.
notes: Also reported by Haussamen that county did not provide agreements in response to IPRA and that a commissioner forwarded them instead.

statement_or_action: County asserted request was overly broad and promised later reply; documents already compiled in one email (per reporting).
notes: Use for accountability on records practices.

actor: Public docs release vs promise content
statement_or_action: Early publicly available legal documents reportedly omitted water-use and $6.9M donation commitments; later updated leases/MOU include them.
source_locator: Haussamen Oct 12, 2025 article describing updated documents; compare to earlier Oct 1 reporting.
timeline_discrepancy: Commitments added/withheld between document versions; track who had which version when.
notes: Use to audit disclosure practices and possible post-vote document changes.

statement_or_action: Letter states environmental assessment incomplete and expected within six months; leases/project schedule anticipate construction 2025-2028 and operations within three years.
source_locator: Amended Motion for Stay attachment (environmental assessment status) + lease job timeline.
timeline_discrepancy: Review timeline may lag project schedule; verify actual EA completion date and prerequisites for construction permits.
notes: Potential conflict between claimed safeguards and readiness to proceed.

statement_or_action: Public-facing narrative treated commitments as enforceable, but MOU §5.1 states no legal rights/obligations other than Appendix B contributions.
notes: Track which commitments are enforceable by which instrument (lease/PPA vs MOU).

actor: County counsel statement vs public expectations
statement_or_action: County counsel indicated key items (jobs/revenue projections) were not required to be specified in the application, while public-facing materials made specific quantitative promises.
source_locator: Amended Motion for Stay attachment includes counsel exchange about not needing to specify key items in the application.
notes: Captures the gap between minimum statutory application requirements and the specific quantitative promises appearing in leases/press materials.

statement_or_action: Briefing notes claim there are no explicit numeric limits on water usage in agreements, but executed leases include an average 20,000 gpd and max 60,000 gpd statement.
source_locator: Search 'no explicit numeric limits' vs lease recitals.
notes: Likely reflects earlier document set or incomplete public release; treat as version-control issue.
